intro: Aegiphila bogotensis f. ternata, commonly known as the Bogotá aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its small, white to pale purple flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats at high elevations. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
